Milky Way (Galactic Center).Notes: The milky in Milky Way is derived from its appearance as a dim glowing band arching across the night sky in which the naked eye cannot distinguish individual stars. (rotate to horizontal) Galileo Galilei first resolved the band of light into individual stars with his telescope in 1610. Located at the very center is an intense radio source named Sagittarius A*, which is likely to be a supermassive black hole about 4.1 million solar masses.
